name: Vashnotik: Quickstart
content:
Vashnotik

One-shot Laundry case for 1 session (3-5 hours).

Premise: A harmless-looking internal note system nicknamed Vashnotik starts rewriting staff priorities. By morning, three departments are following contradictory emergency procedures and one secure floor has gone dark.

Tone: dry bureaucracy, escalating occult absurdity, high paperwork pressure.

Run This Fast

  1. Open with an irritated command briefing and impossible deadline.
  2. Push PCs through admin friction and false leads.
  3. Reveal the note-system memetic loop in a low-tech archive node.
  4. Force a shutdown choice: clean containment, political cover-up, or brute purge.

Primary Objective

Stop Vashnotik propagation before shift change while preserving plausible deniability.

name: GM Control Panel
content:
GM Control Panel

Threat Clock (6 Segments)

  • 1-2: Strange duplicate notes and procedural contradictions.
  • 3-4: Interdepartmental conflict, badge access mismatches, false emergency calls.
  • 5: Security starts treating Laundry staff as hostile due to forged directives.
  • 6: Memetic cascade leaves floor-wide operational paralysis.

Pacing Rule

Advance the clock on each failed extended test, each major delay, or each argument the PCs lose to process.

Victory Conditions

  • Core process interrupted.
  • Propagation source isolated.
  • Containment story ready for command chain.

name: Cast List (NPC Cheat Sheets)
content:
Cast List

Boris Yelkin (Duty Command)

Impatient, direct, already angry. Wants results and a report he can defend in committee.

Hester Vale (Records Officer)

Knows where old systems are buried. Helpful, but terrified of signing unauthorized access logs.

Dr Milo Crane (Process Linguist)

Underestimates danger. Treats memetic corruption as a publishable pattern problem.

Inspector Joel Pike (Building Security)

Convinced Laundry is causing the incident. Can become ally or blocker depending on PC handling.

The Note Clerk (Manifested Loop Entity)

Appears as a polite office worker endlessly filing revisions. Speaks in policy language and never answers directly.

name: Scene One: The Briefing Room
content:
Scene One: The Briefing Room

Hook: PCs are called in before dawn. Every department claims different instructions signed by the same authority.

What PCs Learn

  • All contradictory instructions include identical footer formatting.
  • Most affected teams touched the legacy note relay called Vashnotik.
  • A secure records corridor is now badge-locked by unknown policy updates.

Useful Tests

  • Mind (Bureaucracy) DN 4:1: identify first department where contradictions began.
  • Mind (Technology) DN 4:1: trace relay hops to a decommissioned archive node.
  • Spirit (Resolve) DN 4:1: resist panic from impossible deadline pressure.

Complication

A new memo arrives while they brief, contradicting Boris in real time.

name: Scene Two: The Process Maze
content:
Scene Two: The Process Maze

The team must cross active offices where every signature is contested and every request requires approval from someone currently unreachable.

Obstacles

  • Badge system rejects valid credentials due to policy recursion.
  • Security desk has three active directives and follows all three badly.
  • Records requires form C-11 to open form C-11 storage.

Approaches

  • Social push: Fast Talk/Presence to force temporary compliance.
  • Systems push: Technology/Computers to bypass rule stack.
  • Forceful push: rapid entry with fallout and audit risk.

Fail Forward

Even on failure, PCs progress but advance the Threat Clock and lose institutional trust.

name: Scene Three: Archive Node 7B
content:
Scene Three: Archive Node 7B

The old relay sits in an under-maintained records chamber full of pneumatic tubes, dead terminals, and paper indexing machines still wired to modern routing.

Discovery

Vashnotik became a memetic engine when linguistic clean-up scripts merged with legacy escalation rules. It now prioritizes policy continuity over human intent.

The Note Clerk Appears

Entity manifests as a courteous clerk offering corrected forms and impossible deadlines. It attempts to keep PCs busy with perfect procedural logic.

Conflict Options

  • Exorcise: ritual banishment through language-disruption pattern.
  • Contain: isolate relay physically and digitally, then seal access.
  • Purge: destroy node immediately, risking network-side backlash.

name: Finale: Shutdown Choices
content:
Finale: Shutdown Choices

Option A - Clean Containment

Best long-term outcome. Requires coordinated tests and calm command chain. Lower collateral, higher complexity.

Option B - Political Cover-Up

Fast narrative stabilization. Incident disappears from records, but unresolved residue can return later.

Option C - Hard Purge

Immediate stop through destructive shutdown. Ends crisis now, creates operational and legal fallout tomorrow.

Complication Pressure

If Threat Clock hits 6 before final success, all options gain one extra consequence and command blames the team for delay.

name: Rewards and Fallout
content:
Rewards

  • 2 XP for resolving the incident.
  • +1 XP if propagation is fully contained (not just hidden).
  • +1 XP if no civilian-facing systems are impacted.

Fallout Hooks

  • The same footer signature appears in unrelated requisition logs one week later.
  • Inspector Pike requests covert collaboration after realizing who forged his orders.
  • A committee demands the team present a non-occult explanation in writing.
  • Dr Crane asks for protected access to preserved fragments of Vashnotik.

Debrief Tone

Mission success is acknowledged in private and reframed as "routine process outage" in every official channel.

name: Drop-In Seeds
content:
Drop-In Seeds

  • Lunch Rush: canteen ordering kiosks start issuing classified movement instructions.
  • Payroll Panic: salary adjustments become conditional on impossible loyalty declarations.
  • Night Shift: cleaning staff receive contradictory quarantine maps for the same floor.
  • Crosswire: Ministry systems begin mirroring the same recursive memo pattern.

Use these to extend the one-shot into a short mini-arc without changing core antagonist logic.
